position.marginalia_text: Aristomenes. Pliny. L.ii.c.37. writeth that Aristomenes, by his suttle Stratagemes, and warlike shiftes (being alance) did putt to flighte whole bandes of men. An argume[n]t as wel of his craftines, and suttelty, as of his excelle[n]s, and wonderfull fortitude. Jonathas. Alexander. After he had slaine CCC. Lancedemonians, he was by the once, or twise taken captiue, and cast into pryson, but escapid [their] hands by creeping owte at A litle narrowe hoale in [the] prison; as Foxes and Wesels doe. Being agayne taken he espied conuenient tyme, whe[n] his keepers, and Jaylers were well whitled w[i]th wine, and fast lulled; and then crawlid and rowlid himself to [the] fier; and there burning asunder [the] Cordes, and Gyuer, wherewith he was tyed, (togyther w[i]th part of his body, where they were fastenid) escapid agayne. Being takin [the] third tyme, [the] Lacedemonians his Enemyes, meaning to make suer work with him, and desiring to see what was within him, ripped his brest, and fownd his Harte to be overgrowne with heare. Leuin[u]s Lemnius L.1. de [E[.]ples Alciate in his Emblemes, under [the] name of Aristomenes, commendith Charles [the] fifte.

Moses, & Dauid, imploy notes abowt [their] affaires, but only men of approouid actiuity, & hability. The manner of Princes, & States at this day.
Ex fruitibus eoru[m], cognoscetis eos. Nulla Mundi a[e]tas, tam Empirica, Pragmatica, Cosmopolitica, Mechanica, Chrematistica.

emphasis.text: tam Empirica, Pragmatica, Cosmopolitica, Mechanica, Chrematistica.

marginalia.translation: Pope Adrian said: 'The court of lords, is the one who approves of merits.' 'By their fruits you will know them.' No lifetime of the world is so empirical, pragmatic, cosmopolitan, mechanic, and changeable.
